free_text.Learning outcomes: Time series data arise in many domains and form an important branch of stochastic modelling.  This course will cover the basic ideas and techniques of this domain, and then turn to models particularly useful for financial time series.
free_text.Content: [li] Motivation, basic ideas stochastic processes, trends and seasonal components, prediction, filtering[br/][li] Stationarity[br/][li] Autocorrelation and related functions[br/][li] Stationary ARMA processes: theory and applications[br/][li] Spectral representation of a stationary process: theory and applications[br/][li] State-space models: key ideas and applications[br/][li] Prediction of stationary processes[br/][li] Financial time series: stylised facts, volatility, unit roots and non-stationarity, ARCH, GARCH and related models[br/][li] Stochastic volatility models[br/][li] Multivariate time series[br/][li] Long memory processes
free_text.Type of teaching: Ex cathedra lecture and exercises in the classroom
